basics.name: Theo Moon
basics.title: Software Engineer & Technical Writer
basics.summary: Experienced Software Engineer and Technical Writer dedicated to learning new skills and leveraging technology for social impact. Currently seeking both temporary and permanent roles where I can exercise my diverse skill set, with a particular interest in art, storytelling, data equity, community agreement, AI governance, and care.

work.name: Neverdark Development LLC, Seattle, WA (Hybrid)
highlights: Drive platform research and experimentation, concept exploration, prototyping, and ideation for independent artists and cultural workers across the US, Taiwan, and South Korea.
Write technical documentation and lead training sessions for end-users on new systems, facilitating a smooth adoption process and empowering their artistic expression.
Pro bono work for clients from underserved populations.

work.name: Outreach, Seattle, WA (Hybrid)
work.summary: Outreach is an enterprise Sales Engagement Platform that processes millions of multichannel communications (email, phone, social, SMS) for over 6,000 global customers through AI-powered workflow orchestration. Features include conversation intelligence, CRM integration, role-based governance, & sequence automation.
highlights: Designed, developed, & orchestrated the migration of user licensing data & business logic from a monolithic Rails system to distributed Go microservices via custom Ruby scripts & gRPC/GraphQL APIs. This was a crucial step toward optimizing license usage & enabling the business to diversify its monetization strategy.

Collaborated with stakeholders across backend, frontend, product, design, QA, & support teams, engaging in discussions on customer requirements, conducting code reviews, establishing API agreements, writing technical documentation, debugging, participating in rotational oncall duties, leading Scrum ceremonies, & providing project status updates.

work.name: Outreach, Seattle, WA (Remote)
highlights: Led the end-to-end automation of account setup for trial & subscription services, resulting in reduced manual processing, improved time-to-value, & enhanced prevention of data inconsistencies.
Migrated workflow management to Temporal.io, improving system observability & optimizing the developer experience.

work.name: Outreach, Seattle, WA (Remote)
highlights: Analyzed existing systems to generate a proof of concept for a new automated workflow & conducted thorough testing to ensure reliability & usability before deployment.
Supported project management efforts by maintaining accurate technical documentation, keeping stakeholders informed of progress.

work.name: Scribendi Inc., Chatham, ON, Canada (Remote)
work.summary: Founded in 1997, Scribendi is a pioneering internet-based language company that offers document revision services to clients in all sectors, including business, academia, and publishing. In 2018, Scribendi launched Scribendi.ai, an artificial intelligence and machine learning arm that is creating tools to improve customer experiences and enhance human editors' skills.
highlights: Edited academic and technical documents written in US, British, Australian, and Canadian English by largely ESL clients, providing suggestions to improve both grammar and content.
Contributed valuable insights that helped shape the algorithms and functionalities of Scribendi.ai.

education.area: Ada Developers Academy is a year-long, immersive software development training program for individuals from underrepresented backgrounds.
courses: Learned & implemented new technologies in full-stack web development, Comp Sci fundamentals, & agile practices.

Completed a product lifecycle from conception to delivery as part of my Capstone Project: TaskPie, a time management & task-planning app for Android & iOS developed using Flutter SDK & Google Firebase.

education.institution: National Taiwan University, Chinese Language Division
courses: Granted a competitively awarded international scholarship for studying advanced Mandarin Chinese, sponsored by Taiwan's Ministry of Education.
Completed coursework in Mandarin Chinese, Classical & Modern Chinese Literature, Chinese Linguistics, & East Asian History.
Studied abroad at National Taiwan University in Taipei, Taiwan (2010-2011).
